1.title: US Presidential Election 2024
1.summary: In a closing speech at the Democratic National Convention, Vice President Kamala Harris accepted her party's nomination and emphasised the importance of the upcoming election, condemning former President Donald Trump's actions and warning of the dangers posed by a president without accountability. She also highlighted the chaos of Trump's presidency and the consequences of his actions. Despite calls for a Palestinian American speaker, the convention ended without representation, leading to significant backlash. In her speech, Harris emphasised her commitment to Israel and advocated for Palestinian self-determination, while also advocating for a resolution that ensures security for Israel and dignity for the Palestinian people. She concluded her speech with a message of hope, stating that "it is now our turn to do what generations before us have done, guided by optimism and faith, to fight for this country we love."

Among them are DeSantis, a 44-year-old Florida governor, Hurd, and several long-shot candidates. Other candidates have entered the presidential race with little national name recognition but the deep pockets required to run a major campaign.

6.title: 2024 US Presidential Election: Asian Implications
6.summary: The 2024 US presidential election will be a pivotal moment for the future of the US and its relations with the world. The election will pit incumbent President Joe Biden against former President Donald Trump, who is seeking to reclaim the White House after being impeached twice and facing multiple criminal charges. Issues such as the economy, pandemic, climate change, immigration, health care, and national security will influence the election. The focus will be on the US foreign policy, especially towards Asia, which is a region of vital importance and strategic competition for the US. The US-China rivalry, which has intensified under the Trump and Biden administrations, will also be a central theme of the election, with the US-India partnership also a key focus. The elections will determine whether the US will continue to confront and contain China, or seek to cooperate and coexist.

9.title: 2024 US Presidential Election: Who won the presidential debate?
9.summary: The presidential debate hosted by ABC on September 10, which did not officially declare a winner, sparked intense reactions and discussions across social media platforms. As the debate ended, social media users shared their opinions on who they think won the debate. The interviews and polls conducted by India Today Global indicate that Kamala Harris was ahead of Donald Trump, while some polls indicated that Trump won by a significant margin. CNN's instant polls also indicated that Harris was the winner, with 63 percent of respondents believing she won the debates. The differing perspectives on who performed better highlighted the polarized climate of this election as both candidates continue to campaign. The impact of this debate will likely influence voter perceptions and the trajectory of the race.

10.title: US Election 2024: What If Trump Wins Presidential Election?
10.summary: If Donald Trump wins the US Presidential Election in 2024, his unchecked tendencies could have severe consequences for American democracy if he wins. His second term could see a shift towards authoritarianism, with plans including draconian immigration policies, massive deportations, reinstating the Muslim travel ban, and reshaping energy policy to favour fossil fuels. His approach to regain power is largely motivated by his desire to avoid prison and avoid legal issues. He has been convicted on 34 felony counts related to a hush-money cover-up and facing federal charges related to election interference and a Georgia indictment, and views regaining the White House as a way to abuse power and interfere with his criminal cases. His plans for a second term also include a radical approach to immigration, promising mass deportations of undocumented immigrants. His administration is expected to use broad executive powers to implement these policies, potentially leading to significant constitutional and humanitarian issues. His rhetoric suggests a desire to undermine democratic norms and potentially subvert election processes by challenging constitutional limits.

2.4.title: US Presidential Election
2.4.summary: The outcome of the US presidential election depends on the outcome of four criminal cases, both civil and criminal, which could determine whether or not Trump will run for president. If found guilty in either of the four cases, Trump could face jail time and potentially end his presidential bid. The hush money trial, in which Trump is accused of paying $130,000 to porn star Stormy Daniels, could also pose a significant issue. However, the only impact the criminal cases will have on Trump's candidacy is that they require him to attend court hearings and could impact his time on the campaign trail. The US Constitution does not explicitly prohibit convicted felons from holding the position of president, and there is no procedure to officially nominate an alternative candidate. If Trump wins the Republican party nomination, the GOP lacks a procedure to formally nominate an alternate candidate.

Former US President Donald Trump Is going to announce on Tuesday that he will "run for president" in 2024, one of his close advisers confirmed.

The election campaign of former US President Donald Trump announced, yesterday, Tuesday, that he will appear to the public in South Carolina on the 28th of this month, as part of his quest to run for the 2024 presidential elections. 

According to a campaign announcement, two well-known Republican symbols in South Carolina will join Trump at the state headquarters, where he will reveal his campaign leadership team there, namely Senator Lindsey Graham, one of Trump's most loyal supporters, and Governor Henry McMaster.

10.4.title: US presidential election 2024: Trump's top Republican challengers
10.4.summary:
The path to the 2024 US presidential election begins almost as soon as midterm elections end - and several candidates are already waiting in the wings.

Former president Donald Trump has announced he will run for the party's nominating contest, vowing to "make America great and glorious again".

But while he remains popular with Republican voters, an underwhelming midterm performance, due in part to losses for Trump-endorsed candidates, has left him more vulnerable.

The ex-president, who will be 78 in two years, is likely to face a stiff challenge from a coterie of Republican hopefuls, including some who once backed him. Nikki Haley announced her bid for the presidency in Mid-February, becoming the first major Republican candidate to commit to taking on Mr Trump. Mr Pence, 63, is a born-again evangelical Christian and his addition to the 2016 presidential ticket is credited with helping turn out evangelicals, a crucial voting bloc, for Mr Trump. The two have kept their distance since then, with Mr Pence endorsing several Republican candidates during the 2021 midterm elections, including Georgia Governor Brian Kemp, whose opponent Mr Trump backed.

5.6.title: 2024 US presidential election: Who are the candidates?

Despite these scandals, he remains popular among Republicans and has called them part of a politically motivated witch hunt to thwart his bid for a second four-year term. His support stands at 51% among Republicans, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll conducted from Sept. 8 through Sept. 14. Florida Gov. DeSantis, who is close to Trump's top rival, has positioned himself to the right of Trump on key social issues such as abortion. Despite this, the Supreme Court has yet to hear an appeal against the decision to disqualify him from the primary ballot, which experts believe would strike down the serious implications.

6.6.title: 2024 US Presidential Election;  Ron DeSantis Donald Trump
6.6.summary: Ron De-Santis, the current governor of Florida, has withdrawn from the race for the presidential nomination of the Republican Party, stating he cannot participate in the elections due to differences of opinion with Donald Trump. DeSantis stated that he would support Trump in the election, despite differences in his opinion regarding issues such as Corona and Anthony Fossey. He also stated that Nikki Haley's ideologies are similar to the old Republican leaders and that she has nothing new for the country. This makes it now a direct election between Trump and Haley in the Republican party. Following De-santis' withdrawal, Trump supporters called on all Republicans to rally behind him.

7.7.title: US presidential election 2024: Who are the candidates?
7.7.summary: Two Republican candidates are vying to be the party's presidential nominee for the 2024 general election, with Donald Trump leading with 49% in the latest Reuters/Ipsos polling. If elected again, Trump has promised sweeping changes, including gutting the federal civil service and imposing tougher immigration policies. He also plans to eliminate Obamacare health insurance and impose harsher tariffs on trade with China. Meanwhile, former South Carolina governor and Trump's ambassador to the United Nations, Nikki Haley, has gained a reputation as a solid conservative who can address issues of gender and race in a more credible fashion than many of her peers. Joe Biden is the Democratic Party's presumptive nominee. Despite concerns about his age and poor approval ratings, Biden allies believe he is the only Democratic candidate who can defeat Trump.

9.6.title: US presidential election 2024: Who are the candidates?
9.6.summary: Former President Donald Trump and former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley are competing to be the Republican Party's presidential nominee for the 2024 general election. While President Joe Biden is effectively the Democratic Party's nominee, several third-party hopefuls are also running. Trump, who has been involved in four criminal cases unprecedented for a former American president, is currently the Republican frontrunner with 64%, according to Reuters/Ipsos polling. If elected again, he has promised sweeping changes, including gutting the federal civil service, imposing tougher immigration policies and eliminating Obamacare health insurance. Haley has countered her attacks on Trump, arguing that he is too chaotic and divisive to be effective. Despite being the oldest US president ever, Biden has faced criticism for his handling of immigration policy and the response of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

10.6.title: 2024 US Presidential Election;  Donald Trump Nikki Haley
10.6.summary: Donald Trump won three states from the Republican Party on Saturday (March 2), defeating former South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley. This victory strengthens his claim to become the party's presidential nominee. The biggest day in the US presidential election will be March 5, when elections will be held in 15 states. If Nikki Haley withdraws her name after a big victory in Michigan and Missouri, Trump will remain the only candidate of the Republican party. The Republican Party's primary or caucus voting in other states will continue until June.

1.5.title: Six Pivotal Battlegrounds In 2024 US Presidential Election
1.5.summary: President Joe Biden and his predecessor, Donald Trump, are expected to dominate the 2024 US presidential election, with key battlegrounds expected to be Arizona, Georgia, Michigan, Nevada, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. Each state holds its own vote for the next commander-in-chief, and candidates are awarded "electors" from each state according to its size. With candidates needing 270 electors to win the White House, elections tend to be decided in "swing states" with a history of alternating between Republican and Democratic candidates. However, Trump now leads opinion polling averages in all six. In Georgia, prosecutors have indicted Trump in an election interference case after he urged state officials to "find" enough votes to overturn Biden's 2020 victory. Meanwhile, Biden risks losing the support of a 200,000-strong Arab-American community over his handling of the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.

5.8.title: 2024 US presidential election: Joe Biden's historic decision
5.8.summary: Joe Biden, former US president, announced his decision to withdraw from his bid for a second term in 2024 US presidential bid on November 5, stating that he put the interests of his camp and the US ahead of his ego. This decision came after a disastrous debate with Donald Trump, raising concerns about his physical state and raising fears of an electoral defeat. Despite this, Biden's support for Vice President Kamala Harris, who was involved in all major decisions during his term, was immediately supported by the Democratic Party. The withdrawal revives the Democratic campaign for both the White House and Congress, but only up to a point, with the Republican Party immediately condemning the move as a ploy to manipulate the political machinery. The next Democratic presidential candidate must also decide on which direction they want to take the US.

6.7.title: 2024 US presidential election: Hope has changed sides
6.7.summary: The Democratic National Convention, set to take place in Chicago on August 19, will be the occasion for the coronation of Vice President Kamala Harris, who has been a surprise and unexpected candidate in the US presidential election. The decision by 81-year-old President Joe Biden to replace him in favor of Harris has significantly benefited the Democrats, particularly among Black and Hispanic voters. Harris has since transformed herself from being a lackluster vice president to an energetic candidate with infectious enthusiasm. She has also set out her vision for a presidential term, focusing on improving the purchasing power of the middle class and the role of the federal state in this effort. However, the Republican Party, which retains the advantage in the Electoral College system, is not defeated.

7.8.title: US Presidential Election 2024: What is Project 2025?
7.8.summary: The Republican candidate for the US Presidential elections in November has denied allegations of his connections to 'Project 2025', an ultra-conservative playbook created by a group of conservatives as a plan for his second term in office. The Heritage Foundation, a conservative American think tank, published Project 2025 as a blueprint for the 2025 Presidential Transition. The project was established in 2022 and has been working on several changes to economic and social policies to make the federal government and its agencies more conservative. The team that created the project has 140 former Trump staffers, including its director Paul Dans, who was chief of staff at the Office of Personnel Management while Trump was president. While many Republicans have downplayed or distanced themselves from Project 2025, Democrats have played it up in the election campaign.

8.6.title: US Presidential Election 2024: Who Is Tulsi Gabbard?
8.6.summary: Tulsi Gabbard, a former U.S. Congresswoman and 2020 Democratic presidential candidate, has officially joined Donald Trump's campaign for the upcoming U.K. presidential election. The announcement was made on August 26 during an event in Detroit. Gabard, who previously served as the vice chair of the Democratic National Committee, was warmly welcomed by Trump, who praised her achievements and welcomed her to his campaign stage. She has been a vocal critic of "forever wars" throughout her political career and has advocated for a foreign policy that emphasizes restraint. Gabbaard's support for Trump has been widely received.

9.7.title: Exclusive: 2024 US Presidential Election: Predictions are in!
9.7.summary: Professor Allan Jay Lichtman, known as the "Nostradamus of US elections", has revealed his predictions for the 2024 US presidential election. His "Keys to the White House" model uses 13 criteria to determine whether the incumbent party's presidential candidate is likely to win or lose the next election. These criteria include party mandate, contest, no serious primary contest for the incumbent's nomination, no major third-party or independent campaigns, and no major scandals. Lichtmen's predictions have been widely criticised by academics and academics, but he insists his methods work on an administration-by-administration basis. He also addressed criticism of Kamala Harris, predicting her as the first woman president of South Asian and African American origin or first Indian and black woman.

10.8.title: 2024: Again, Donald Trump bid for US presidential election
10.8.summary:
2024: Again, Donald Trump bid for US presidential election. 

Former United States President, Donald Trump, Tuesday announced his intention to run for the White House once again in the 2024 presidential election. 

In a speech at Mar-a-Lago, Trump said that from the moment he left office almost two years ago, speculation was rife that he intended to return.

“I am tonight announcing my candidacy for president of the United States. 

“For millions of Americans, the two years under Joe Biden have been a time of pain, hardship and despair.
